crypto.name: hashbrown
crypto.desc: I made fresh hashbrowns fresh hash function.

crypto.name: treestore
crypto.desc: I learned about IPFS the other day and tried rolling my own implementation!

crypto.name: xnor
crypto.desc: XNOR! It's like XOR, but it's actually the complete opposite.

crypto.name: zkwarmup
crypto.desc: I just think zero-knowledge proofs are kinda neat

forensic.name: couch potato
forensic.desc: I am a real american, down to my favorite pastime!

forensic.name: duck pics
forensic.desc: got a capture on the chall author while engaging in "personal matters". see what you can find.

forensic.name: hall effect
forensic.desc: Hint: finding the device firmware may be helpful

forensic.name: reduce recycle
forensic.desc: I forgot the randomly generated 12-character password I used to encrypt these files.... is there anything you can do to help me get my flag back??

forensic.name: the CIA
forensic.desc:
I was handed this top-secret CIA document, but I've been told the password on it isn't crackable. The document seems pretty old, maybe there's a different way to open it..?

Author note: Competitors with very slow computers may have some struggle with this challenge. To help speed things up: the first byte is b8 (you'll know what this means later)

forensic.name: unknown
forensic.desc: Some may call this junk. Me, I call them treasures.

forensic.name: wreck
forensic.desc: I hate when my ship crashes

misc.name: Free C Compiler Online
misc.desc: It is free of charge, but is it free of bugs?

misc.name: gentleman
misc.desc:
Time to do the impossible.

Hint: check Corgo's messages in the #misc channel on Discord.

pwn.name: D.I.S.A.
pwn.desc:
disa is the panicle of high performance and innovative design. 13bit is the future, everything else is pure cope. Embrace the performance and safety of disa

Co-authored by: auska

pwn.name: Gents Favorite Model
pwn.desc:
AI is nothing without you. Inspire me!!

Note: this challenge is very resource-intensive. Please solve locally, then submit a ticket.

pwn.name: infrequentc
pwn.desc: Struggling with the cryptography section? This C program can perform frequency analysis for you in the blink of an eye!

pwn.name: no handouts
pwn.desc: I just found a way to kill ROP. I think. Maybe?

pwn.name: runway0
pwn.desc:
If you've never done a CTF before, this runway should help!

Hint: MacOS users (on M series) will need a x86 Linux VM. Tutorial is here: pwnoh.io/utm

pwn.name: sailing the c
pwn.desc: The king of flags has sent you on a journey across the world with nothing but a pie. Will you prevail?

rev.name: datafrog
rev.desc: A fact and a rule we might blend, In Datalog, data's our friend. Through join after join, With little to coin, We always reach truth in the end.

rev.name: flagwatch
rev.desc: Did you know that you can compile AutoHotKey scripts?

rev.name: text adventure
rev.desc: I just wrote a text adventure game after learning Java, but maybe I should've added some instructions....

rev.name: thank
rev.desc: I am so grateful for your precious files!

web.name: SSFS
web.desc: I made a file server to easily share my files with my friends. Nobody has hacked it yet, so I'm sure it's secure.

web.name: dojo
web.desc: The dojo stores many riches. Can you make it through the gauntlet?

web.name: homecooked
web.desc: I've been working on my own ASGI-complaint Python web framework. It's still in the early stages, but I think it's coming along nicely. I've set up a demo site for you to try it out. Can you find the flag?

web.name: homecookeds revenge
web.desc: It came to my attention that some of you took the lazy way out. Well rest assured this version of homecooked is not going to be as easy as the last one.

web.name: quotes
web.desc: I'm launching 🚀 my new ✨ SaaS providing quotes 📝 as an API 💪!
